db:abstract.db:para: A request for showing a tooltip to the user.
This type was introduced in QtWebEngine 1.10.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A TooltipRequest is a request object that is passed as a parameter of the WebEngineView::tooltipRequested signal. Use the onTooltipRequested signal handler to handle requests for custom tooltip menus at specific positions.
The accepted property of the request indicates whether the request is handled by the user code or the default tooltip should be displayed.
The following code uses a custom tooltip to handle the request:

db:section.db:title: accepted : bool
db:section.db:para: Indicates whether the tooltip request has been accepted by the signal handler.
If the property is false after any signal handlers for WebEngineView::tooltipRequested have been executed, a default tooltip will be shown. To prevent this, set request.accepted to true.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] text : bool
db:section.db:para: The text of the tooltip. It contains an empty string when the tooltip should be hidden.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] type : enumeration
db:section.db:para: The type of the tooltip request.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] x : int
db:section.db:para: The x coordinate of the top-left corner of the requested tooltip.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] y : int
db:section.db:para: The y coordinate of the top-left corner of the requested tooltip.
